verses.text: 歸還約櫃與獻賠罪禮物耶和華的約櫃在非利士人的地方有七個月之久。

words.note: Literary particle marking duration.

verses.text: 非利士人把眾祭司和占卜的都召了來，問他們：「我們應該怎樣處理耶和華的約櫃呢？請告訴我們，要怎樣才能把它送回原處呢？」
他們回答：「你們把以色列 神的約櫃送回去的時候，不可空空地把它送回去，卻要償還賠罪的禮物，這樣，你們就可以得著醫治，也可以知道，為甚麼他的手沒有離開你們。」

words.note: Refers to the God of Israel, used as a proper noun.
Reduplication '空空' emphasizes 'empty'.
More formal or literary than '得到'.

verses.text: 非利士人問：「我們應當償給他甚麼作賠罪的禮物呢？」他們回答：「要按照非利士人各城首領的數目，用五個金痔瘡和五隻金老鼠作賠罪的禮物，因為你們所有的人和你們各城的首領所遭遇的，都是一樣的災禍。

words.note: Refers to the golden images of tumors/hemorrhoids in the biblical context.
Refers to the golden images of mice/rats in the biblical context.
Forms a nominalized phrase with the following verb.

verses.text: 所以你們要做痔瘡的像和毀壞田地的老鼠的像，還要把榮耀歸給以色列的 神。也許他會向你們、你們的神和你們的田地手下留情。

words.note: Refers to the God of Israel, used as a proper noun.
Here refers to the Philistine gods, not the God of Israel.
Idiom: lit. 'under hand keep feelings'.

verses.text: 你們為甚麼要硬著心，像以前埃及人和法老那樣呢？ 神嚴嚴地對付他們以後，他們不是放走了以色列人，以色列人不是真的離開了嗎？

words.note: Common idiom in biblical context for stubbornness.
Transliteration of Pharaoh, ancient Egyptian king title.
The space before '神' is a convention in some Chinese Bibles to show reverence for God.
Reduplication of '嚴' for emphasis.
Used here in a rhetorical question.
Used here in a rhetorical question.

verses.text: 現在你們要預備一輛新車和兩頭仍在乳養小牛、未曾負過軛的母牛，把牠們緊緊套在車上，把小牛從牠們身邊帶回棚裡去。

words.note: Reduplication for emphasis.

verses.text: 你們要把耶和華的約櫃搬來，放在車上，把那些償給他作賠罪禮物的金器放在盒子裡，放置在約櫃旁邊，然後把它送上路，讓它自己走。

words.note: Transliteration of the Hebrew name for God.
Lit. 'apology gift', referring to an offering for atonement.

words.definition: send on its way, set off

verses.text: 你們要留意看，如果它是走向自己的境界，往伯．示麥去，那麼就是耶和華降這大災給我們；如果不是這樣，我們就知道，不是他的手攻擊我們，我們遭遇的不過是偶然的事。」

words.note: A city in ancient Judah, meaning 'house of the sun'.
Transliteration of the Hebrew name for God.

verses.text: 非利士人就照著去行。他們牽來兩頭還在乳養小牛的母牛，把牠們緊緊套在車上，把小牛關在棚裡。

words.note: Reduplication for emphasis.

verses.text: 他們又把耶和華的約櫃，裝金老鼠和痔瘡像的盒子，都放在車上。

words.note: A medical term used in a biblical narrative.
Used as a locative suffix here.

verses.text: 牛向著伯．示麥的路上直奔，如同走在一條大路上，一面走一面叫，不偏左也不偏右。非利士各城的首領在後面跟著走，直到伯．示麥的邊界。

words.note: More formal or literary than just 'run'.
For long, narrow objects.
Used as a locative suffix here.
Used in '一面...一面...' construction.
Used in '一面...一面...' construction.
Contextually means 'to moo' for an ox.

verses.text: 約櫃停在伯．示麥那時，伯．示麥人正在谷中收割麥子，他們舉目觀看，看見了約櫃，就歡歡喜喜迎見約櫃。

words.definition: in the process of, just then

words.note: A somewhat literary or biblical expression.

words.definition: to see, to catch sight of

words.note: AABB reduplication for emphasis, expressing intense joy.

verses.text: 牛車到了伯．示麥人約書亞的田間，就停在那裡；那裡有一塊大石，他們把做那車的木料劈開，又把那兩隻母牛作燔祭獻給耶和華。

words.note: For pieces, chunks, or land.
For animals or certain paired objects.
More formal or religious than a simple 'give'.

verses.text: 利未人把耶和華的約櫃，與它一同送來裝有金器的盒子，都搬了下來，放在大石上；那一天，伯．示麥人向耶和華獻上燔祭，又獻上其他的祭。

words.note: Often found in biblical contexts describing temple items.
Directional complement indicating movement downwards towards the speaker/context.
Used as a locative suffix here.
Common in religious and formal contexts for making offerings or presenting.
Common in religious and formal contexts for making offerings or presenting.

verses.text: 非利士人的五個首領看見了，當天就回以革倫去。

words.note: Indicates direction or completed action away from the speaker.

verses.text: 這些金痔瘡，就是非利士人償給耶和華作賠罪的禮物的，一個是為亞實突，一個是為迦薩，一個是為亞實基倫，一個是為迦特，一個是為以革倫。

words.note: Lit. 'compensate sin'.

verses.text: 金老鼠的數目是按照非利士人五個首領所有的城市的數目，包括設防城和鄉村。他們安放耶和華約櫃的那塊大石，直到現在還是在伯．示麥人約書亞的田間，是一個證物。
耶和華因為伯．示麥人偷窺他的約櫃，就擊殺他們；他擊殺了七十人（「七十人」大多數抄本都作「五萬零七十人」，少數抄本作「七十人」）。眾人因為耶和華用大災擊殺他們，就哀哭起來。

words.note: Indicates the beginning or intensification of an action.

verses.text: 伯．示麥人說：「在耶和華這位聖潔的 神面前，誰能站立得住呢？他可以從我們這裡上到哪裡去呢？」

words.note: Respectful measure word for persons.
The empty space before '神' is a respectful character spacing often used for God/Lord in Chinese Bibles.
A verb complement indicating the ability to withstand or hold firm.
Indicates direction or completed action away from the speaker.

verses.text: 於是他們派遣使者到基列．耶琳的居民那裡去，對他們說：「非利士人把耶和華的約櫃送回來了。你們下來把它接到你們那裡去吧。」

words.note: Connects an event to a previous action.
Often used for official or formal sending.
Lit. 'sent person'.
An ancient city in Judah.
Ancient people of Philistia.
Introduces the object of a verb.
The covenant name of God.
A sacred chest containing the tablets of the Ten Commandments.
Combines 'send', 'return', and 'towards speaker's location'.
Indicates completion or change of state.
Directional verb indicating movement downwards toward the speaker/reference.
Introduces the object of a verb, implying disposal or action upon it.
Used as a verb complement to indicate result of reaching a location.
Indicates movement away from the speaker/reference.
Indicates a suggestion or mild command.
